text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

Hi, I'm Sarah Schewe, and
I am the founder of Mosaic.

Mosaic is a health care data
aggregator and app store.
My background is in health care.

And before HBS, I
worked for Epic.
And this is my dad.

This summer, my dad was
diagnosed with a brain tumor.

And the weird thing was, he
had seen a lot of doctors.

He'd been showing
symptoms for years,

but no one had
connected the dots.

It reminded me of the story of
the blind men and the elephant,

where these men are
standing around an elephant,
but they can't see it.

They can only feel what they
can reach out and touch.

So each of them thinks they're
touching something different.

One man thinks he's
touching a brick wall.
Another thinks it's a rope.

No one's getting
the full picture.

We've ended up with a
health care system where

doctors can see only
pieces of what's
going on with their patients.

See, we've had rapid adoption
of electronic medical records
in this country.

But the issue is there
weren't clear standards

around how this data needed
to be stored or exchanged.

So we've ended up with systems
that can't talk to each other.

We have more data than we have
ever had, but it's siloed.
Mosaic solves this.

Mosaic aggregates data
across the continuum of care,

provides a complete
picture of what's

going on with the
patient, and makes

it possible to run machine
learning and AI algorithms.

With funding from NVC,
we'll be able to build out
our pilot this summer.
I'd love your support.

I believe we can bring all the
pieces together with Mosaic.
